intro: Engelhardia guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan Engelhardia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to Central America, particularly Guatemala, and is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and showy white to pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as tropical forests. Its fruits are small, capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature. Engelhardia guatemalensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological role in its native habitat.
